comment: Awesome professor! Answers questions respectfully. Three difficult exams including a cumulative final. One notes sheet allowed per exam. Homework sets due almost every monday with answers posted usually by sunday. If she taught other econ courses here, I would definitely take her again; too bad this was her last semester here at ksu.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This one of the econ classes that you must work for to get A or a B
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was easily one of the best teachers to have for the course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is the best econ teacher for this course !!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things
Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: She is an awesome professor! Take her! Yes, she makes you work for your grade, but I loved her lectures. She makes BU Stat understandable. I am actually considering getting a minor in data analysis because of her. HW every week, 4 tests including the final
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Majority of your grade is homework and its easy!! I made A on everything except the tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: While this class regardless is definitely difficult for most, She was easily one of the best teachers to have for the course. She always gave extremely good tips for how to do some of the most complex problems, and she made the homework a great study tool for the tests. Ultimately, she makes the class easier than it actually is. Take her!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Holmes is one of the kindest professors I have ever had. She is always willing to answer questions and help you with anything. I wouldnt recommend missing her class and not completing her homework. While her class is not terribly hard, it definitely takes effort.

Amazing professor. I had taken statistics courses before so I found it relatively easy but it can be a difficult subject with any professor. She doesn't just hand out extra credit and bump people but her homework does not take long and counts for a good portion of your grade. She also posts answers before the homework is due so you can check.

I took her in her first year teaching at KSU. She is the BEST. You can tell she really cares and she is super friendly. She makes your questions seem super valid and explains well. She is open to office visitors when you get confused and still says hi in the halls. Wish I could take her again!

2 tests and cumulative final. Allowed one sheet of handwritten notes for each semester test and 2 sheets for final. Super caring and will explain thoroughly if needed. Always available during office hours. Emails back within a couple hours. Problem sets given almost every class and answers posted by the weekends and due the following Monday. Take!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: There are 3 tests and she lets you use a whole sheet front and back of your notes. On the cumulative final she lets you use all the sheets you have made. There is problem sets she gives you almost every day of class that are all due on Monday, but she gives you all the answers to the sets on Sunday. Great teacher, she is new and super sweet! Take!
